ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to conduct and synthesize independent research over the course of a year.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Class meetings were basically just group check-ins and I think they could have been more productive if we met in smaller groups.

Its nice that we have some kind of structure compared to other majors, and the deadlines were not as hard set as they appeared on the syllabus. Overall I was satisfied with the information, help, and guidance we received over the year.
Professor Erickson & my advisor provided tons of resources to make the most of the course. I think the course is really either great or not depending on your advisor.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you are a sociology major you will have to either take nonintensive or intensive; I definitely recommend doing the intensive route as its a lot of work but its so rewarding to be able to add knowledge to the field of research.
Mandatory-- not much of a choice, but it's not as bad as I thought.
Id totally recommend doing a year long intensive for Sociology. Its nice being able to do a deep dive into a subject of your choice.
